name: lib/es-http-proxy/common.js
isSSL
description: Simple Regex for testing if protocol is https

name: setupOutgoing

params.name: Outgoing
params.description: Base object to be filled with required properties

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

params.name: Forward
params.description: String to select forward or target

return.description: Outgoing Object with all required properties set

name: setupSocket
description:
Set the proper configuration for sockets,
set no delay and set keep alive, also set
the timeout to 0.

Examples:

   setupSocket(socket)
   // => Socket

name: getPort
description: Get the port number from the host. Or guess it based on the connection type.

name: hasEncryptedConnection
description: Check if the request has an encrypted connection.

return.description: Whether the connection is encrypted or not.

name: urlJoin
description: OS-agnostic join (doesn't break on URLs like path.join does on Windows)>

name: hasPort
description: Check the host and see if it potentially has a port in it (keep it simple)

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Whether we have one or not

return.description: Whether we have one or not

name: lib/es-http-proxy/index.js
content:
import http from 'http'
import https from 'https'
import url from 'url'
import ProxyServer from './ProxyServer'

/**
 * Export the proxy "Server" as the main export.
 */
 export default ProxyServer

/**
 * Creates the proxy server.
 *
 * Examples:
 *
 *    httpProxy.createProxyServer({ .. }, 8000)
 *    // => '{ web: [Function], ws: [Function] ... }'
 *
 * @param {Object} Options Config object passed to the proxy
 *
 * @return {Object} Proxy Proxy object with handlers for `ws` and `web` requests
 *
 * @api public
 */

/** TODO: WHY SO MANY ALIASES */
//export const createServer = createProxyServer
//export const createProxy = createProxyServer
export function createProxyServer(options) {
  /*
   *  `options` is needed and it must have the following layout:
   *
   *  {
   *    target : <url string to be parsed with the url module>
   *    forward: <url string to be parsed with the url module>
   *    agent  : <object to be passed to http(s).request>
   *    ssl    : <object to be passed to https.createServer()>
   *    ws     : <true/false, if you want to proxy websockets>
   *    xfwd   : <true/false, adds x-forward headers>
   *    secure : <true/false, verify SSL certificate>
   *    toProxy: <true/false, explicitly specify if we are proxying to another proxy>
   *    prependPath: <true/false, Default: true - specify whether you want to prepend the target's path to the proxy path>
   *    ignorePath: <true/false, Default: false - specify whether you want to ignore the proxy path of the incoming request>
   *    localAddress : <Local interface string to bind for outgoing connections>
   *    changeOrigin: <true/false, Default: false - changes the origin of the host header to the target URL>
   *    auth   : Basic authentication i.e. 'user:password' to compute an Authorization header.
   *    hostRewrite: rewrites the location hostname on (301/302/307/308) redirects, Default: null.
   *    autoRewrite: rewrites the location host/port on (301/302/307/308) redirects based on requested host/port. Default: false.
   *    protocolRewrite: rewrites the location protocol on (301/302/307/308) redirects to 'http' or 'https'. Default: null.
   *  }
   *
   *  NOTE: `options.ws` and `options.ssl` are optional.
   *    `options.target and `options.forward` cannot be
   *    both missing
   *  }
   */

  return new ProxyServer(options)
}

name: createProxyServer
description: TODO: WHY SO MANY ALIASES

name: lib/es-http-proxy/passes/web-incoming.js
deleteLength
description: Sets `content-length` to '0' if request is of DELETE type.

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

name: timeout
description: Sets timeout in request socket if it was specified in options.

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

name: XHeaders
description: Sets `x-forwarded-*` headers if specified in config.

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

name: stream
description:
Does the actual proxying. If `forward` is enabled fires up
a ForwardStream, same happens for ProxyStream. The request
just dies otherwise.

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

name: lib/es-http-proxy/passes/web-outgoing.js
removeChunked
description: If is a HTTP 1.0 request, remove chunk headers

params.name: Res
params.description: Response object from the proxy request

name: setConnection
description:
If is a HTTP 1.0 request, set the correct connection header
or if connection header not present, then use `keep-alive`

params.name: Res
params.description: Response object from the proxy request

name: writeHeaders
description:
Copy headers from proxyResponse to response
set each header in response object.

params.name: Res
params.description: Response object from the proxy request

name: writeStatusCode
description: Set the statusCode from the proxyResponse

params.name: Res
params.description: Response object from the proxy request

name: lib/es-http-proxy/passes/ws-incoming.js
checkMethodAndHeader
description:
WebSocket requests must have the `GET` method and
the `upgrade:websocket` header

name: XHeaders
description: Sets `x-forwarded-*` headers if specified in config.

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

name: stream
description:
Does the actual proxying. Make the request and upgrade it
send the Switching Protocols request and pipe the sockets.

params.name: Options
params.description: Config object passed to the proxy

name: lib/es-http-proxy/ProxyServer.js
createRightProxy
description:
Returns a function that creates the loader for
either `ws` or `web`'s  passes.

Examples:

   httpProxy.createRightProxy('ws')
   // => [Function]

return.description: Loader Function that when called returns an iterator for the right passes
